titles.title: Veterans' Memorial Marker Act of 2006

To amend title 38, United States Code, to extend and expand the application of the Department of Veterans Affairs benefit for Government markers for marked graves of veterans buried in private cemeteries and to provide Government markers or memorial headstones for deceased dependent children of veterans whose remains are unavailable for burial.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

bill.summary: 3/29/2006--Introduced. Veterans' Memorial Marker Act of 2006 - Amends: (1) federal veterans' benefits provisions to extend through 2007 the authority for the provision by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs of government markers or memorial headstones for the marked graves of veterans buried in private cemeteries; and (2) the Veterans Education and Benefits Expansion Act of 2001 to make eligible for such markers or headstones certain veterans dying on or after November 1, 1990 (currently, September 11, 2001). Requires the Secretary to furnish such markers or headstones for certain dependent children of veterans whose remains are unavailable for burial.
